instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Audio on Playback
threads.message:
Hi have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that will beep on startup but doesn't show an audio device within MacOS and doesn't play audio thru speakers or headphone jack.

Checked <CHIP>U6200</CHIP> Pin 6 <SIGNAL>PP4V5_AUDIO_ANALOG</SIGNAL> = 4.48V
Checked <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> Pin 9 <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0_AUDIO_DIG</SIGNAL>= 1.5V
Checked <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> Pin 46 <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_AUDIO</SIGNAL>=5.04V

Headphone Jack looks OK.

Any suggestions? Noticed someone mentioned to remove <RESISTOR>R6805</RESISTOR> rather than replacing headphone jack.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Audio on Playback
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R6805</RESISTOR> does the trick if stuck in SPDIF mode.
If audio codec is not recognized in System Report, the issue is not from the jack side.
Check <SIGNAL>HDA_RST_L</SIGNAL> level.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Audio on Playback
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Audio on Playback
threads.message: Compare with good board if 1.5V is good level.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Audio on Playback
threads.message: Tested with another machine and 1.5V is a good level as the other had 1.51V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Audio on Playback
threads.message:
"If audio codec is not recognized in System Report"
Did you check that?

Check all series resistors on HDA lines between PCH and audio codec.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Audio on Playback
threads.message:
I checked <RESISTOR>R1810</RESISTOR>,<RESISTOR>R1811</RESISTOR>,<RESISTOR>R1812</RESISTOR>,<RESISTOR>R1813</RESISTOR>,<RESISTOR>R6211</RESISTOR>,<RESISTOR>R6212</RESISTOR> and they are good.

System Report for Audio Devices does not show any input or output, not sure what you mean by audio codec showing up in system report.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Audio on Playback
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Audio on Playback
threads.message:
By chance I swapped out the board with another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and noticed that it was also reporting the same issue.....so I re-installed the Mojave MacOS and the problem is solved without any hardware.

Please close this thread.
